channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: It took about 10 seconds for Russian television producer Marina Ovsyannikova to transform herself from a Kremlin propaganda cog into the most daring dissident opposed to Putin's war. “The future of my country is being decided right now,” she tells WSJ. https://t.co/nypUCnTrRL

President Biden and Chinese leader Xi Jinping plan to speak in a call scheduled for Friday, as the U.S. works to deter China from deeper involvement with Russia during its invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/ROmzTnWwWk

A U.S. teacher who was in Ukraine caring for his sick partner was killed during a Russian attack on Chernihiv, a city north of Kyiv, according to his sister and a local official https://t.co/JUoWA4ptMO
Russia began the war in Ukraine with the world’s largest tank force but the losses it has suffered reveal its weaknesses on the modern battlefield https://t.co/uIsoFVFAoV
An ominous speech by Russian President Vladimir Putin laid out a wartime regime that will tolerate no dissent, with those having ties to the West in the Kremlin’s sights https://t.co/Rbsbu3gJu3
The House passed legislation to end normal trade ties with Russia, a move backed by Biden that could result in higher tariffs on some imports https://t.co/dBUWF5kGxP
From @WSJopinion: Ukraine is World War 2½, writes @DanHenninger. Virtually all of the world’s democracies have committed to repelling Russia. https://t.co/MozIXcWqHg
Essay: The Russian Orthodox Church helped forge the ideology behind Putin’s war on Ukraine https://t.co/z1rCtfV4F7
In rural Russia, locals back Putin’s decision to send an army to Ukraine. “I support everything that is for victory and for Putin.” https://t.co/OVUtsDWiKz
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/AsQV6ZJm9y https://t.co/A02W6XyPjQ

From @WSJopinion: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has inspired the world with his wartime leadership. The question is whether the U.S., and especially its Commander in Chief, is finally going to meet this historic moment. https://t.co/UWILFxsbK1

The U.N.’s cultural agency will provide personal protective equipment such as bullet-proof vests and helmets to journalists in Ukraine, after several have been killed since Russia’s invasion of the country began https://t.co/9JhxKgqYRQ

With initial bids due on Friday, Roman Abramovich’s Chelsea Football Club has attracted interest from more than 20 different parties, including American investors, a group from Saudi Arabia and a British consortium led by a former Olympic champion https://t.co/Luj5TbErKU

From @WSJopinion: SEC Chairman Gary Gensler wants to impose costly new regulations that further discourage companies from going public, and then “level the playing field” by punishing companies that stay private https://t.co/uVct5K05TT

Russia spent heavily to revamp its military. It has floundered in Ukraine, its first major test. “They have never had to operate these complex systems in this kind of conflict since at least the end of the Cold War.” https://t.co/8mNSmQKoQ2
Ukraine’s international crowdfunding effort to support its army has raised more than $400 million for troops and for humanitarian aid so far https://t.co/V0ciM26cLv
Odessa-based programmer Wang Jixian challenges Chinese fans of Vladimir Putin to put words into action on the battlefield, attracting millions of views https://t.co/WmZsnOWnM8
A New Zealand couple hoped the 17-pound tuber they found in their garden would break the Guinness Record for a giant potato. DNA testing showed it wasn’t even a potato. https://t.co/cr1WB8pM3x
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/6pZYgfXhKS https://t.co/dN0zxCtSgh

Satellite images of Ukraine show some of the destruction caused by fighting Wednesday, as Ukraine's military launched a counteroffensive against Russian forces in Kyiv and other key cities https://t.co/TVEvr26hPH
NASA shared an image showing a distant star backed by galaxies, saying the James Webb telescope is performing as well as if not better than their most optimistic prediction https://t.co/io9L3bPPdd

Former CNN anchor Chris Cuomo is seeking at least $125 million from his old employer, claiming the network wrongfully terminated him and smeared his journalistic integrity in the process https://t.co/P3JQq43b47

In the two-day battle of Voznesensk, the military and local volunteers repelled much-better-armed Russian forces, who fled leaving behind tanks, rocket launchers and dead soldiers. “The Russians didn’t expect us to be so strong.” https://t.co/VdU7caoEqg
Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe, the British national who was imprisoned in Iran in 2016, left the country on Wednesday https://t.co/USgyV3MYSL

A Chinese spy hired a private investigator to use violence if necessary to end a candidate’s run for U.S. Congress, instructing him to “beat him until he cannot run for election,” prosecutors alleged as they unsealed a series of complaints https://t.co/HqOQuzycaz

A deepfake video purporting to show Ukraine’s president issuing a statement he didn't make has been removed from Facebook and Instagram, Meta's head of security policy said Wednesday https://t.co/cZYyHfFl2s
Starbucks, iPhones and Ikea became part of urban Russians' daily life. Some worry things will never be the same. “Now, my children will live in the new old Soviet Union." https://t.co/Ay8OlU0MYq
Two members of Congress are seeking to formally honor journalists who have been injured or killed since Russia invaded Ukraine https://t.co/lybYcmyO6x
Vladimir Putin acknowledged that the Russian economy was hit hard by sanctions but says the West’s “economic blitzkrieg” had failed https://t.co/0zCPR90OTD
President Biden said he thinks Russian President Vladimir Putin is a war criminal, an escalation of his rhetoric as Moscow continues its attack in Ukraine https://t.co/dpfjj9jp7c

Attorney General Merrick Garland directed federal agencies to “apply a presumption of openness” when fulfilling Freedom of Information Act requests, as the denial rate for such inquiries has risen in recent years https://t.co/weRlijgmeQ
Italian police on Wednesday seized real estate and vehicles owned by two sanctioned Russian oligarchs, including mining magnate Alisher Usmanov https://t.co/YbU3bMZrPB

President Biden said the U.S. will send an additional $800 million in security assistance to Ukraine as the country tries to fend off Russia’s invasion, including 800 anti-aircraft systems to help defend its airspace https://t.co/TlDeDuOBut

China and Russia have often been contentious rivals, but under Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin, the two countries’ relations have grown closer. Here is a look at the tensions over China’s entente with Russia and what it could mean for the U.S. https://t.co/VnVH6Tyd4M

McDonald's, Levi's and other U.S. brands flooded into Russia in the 1990s. The attack on Ukraine looks to some like a death knell for the relationship. “It’s certainly the end of an era." https://t.co/h6kxFddvco

The Russian government has a big set of interest payments due to foreign bondholders on Wednesday, setting the stage for a potential default #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/vylaV9Q3PF https://t.co/oKQUQoytvr

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky urged the U.S. to put in place a no-fly zone. "Russia has turned the Ukrainian sky into a source of death," he said in an emotional address to Congress. https://t.co/4imi3a5LOd
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/aVnMOM3fbx https://t.co/gNTFyslzX6
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky will speak directly to the U.S. Congress in a virtual address, where he is expected to ask for more military aid. Watch live. https://t.co/zQGYQqsBHI
With NATO on high alert for Russian incursions into alliance territory, Ukraine’s military said it downed a Russian drone that had crossed into Polish airspace https://t.co/McfsIpJBoM
British Prime Minister Boris Johnson is visiting the United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia to deliver a plea from the West: pump more oil https://t.co/UpH9K4ij7j
Ukraine said it launched a counteroffensive against Russian forces encroaching on Kyiv and other key cities, seeking to reverse the momentum of the war https://t.co/0w12uvmIyQ
Odessa-based programmer Wang Jixian challenges Chinese fans of Vladimir Putin to put words into action on the battlefield, attracting millions of views https://t.co/PO2opNSEAZ
A year ago, China’s Xi Jinping appeared unassailable. Since then, thin cracks have emerged in his power. https://t.co/zZCHbfMUiZ
The woman who burst onto the set of Russia’s most-watched news program Monday evening with an antiwar poster was fined for protest violation https://t.co/YLcMkGYNyt
A year ago, China’s Xi Jinping appeared unassailable. Since then, thin cracks have emerged in his power. https://t.co/lQFRlhHAeK

From @WSJopinion: The Fed is supposed to have the world’s smartest economists and access to the best financial information. How could they make the greatest monetary policy mistake since the 1970s? https://t.co/4UGqAzUulr
Saudi Arabia is in talks to price its oil sales to China in yuan, people familiar with the matter said. The move would dent the U.S. dollar's dominance of the oil market. https://t.co/vXULohStxJ
The effort to make daylight-saving time a permanent fixture got a boost after senators unanimously passed the Sunshine Protection Act Tuesday. It now heads to the House. https://t.co/IJohKXeVqb
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/4AxCYLPlCu https://t.co/vEBcbfjuUT
